docs.lead_paragraph: It's ethical to test a provocative new fertility technique that would prevent mothers from passing on rare but devastating diseases by creating embryos from the DNA of three people — dad, mom and an egg donor — advisers to the government said Wednesday.

headline.main: Report: It's Ethical to Test Embryos From DNA of 3 People
headline.print_headline: Report: It's Ethical to Test Embryos From DNA of 3 People

docs.lead_paragraph: The Latest on the mosquito-born Zika virus, which is linked to brain deformities in babies (all times local):

headline.main: The Latest: Official Urges Americas to Spend More on Zika
headline.print_headline: The Latest: Official Urges Americas to Spend More on Zika

docs.snippet: The Latest on the mosquito-born Zika virus, which is linked to brain deformities in babies (all times local):

docs.lead_paragraph: The World Health Organization voiced concern on Wednesday over the reported sexual transmission of the Zika virus in Texas amid worries that such infections could make battling it even tougher. There is no vaccine or treatment for Zika.

headline.main: Zika Alarm Rises After U.S. Sex Link, More Brazil Birth Defects
headline.print_headline: Zika Alarm Rises After U.S. Sex Link, More Brazil Birth Defects

docs.snippet: The World Health Organization voiced concern on Wednesday over the reported sexual transmission of the Zika virus in Texas amid worries that such infections could make battling it even tougher. There is no vaccine or treatment for Zika.

docs.lead_paragraph: Christopher Sorrentino’s latest novel centers on a Brooklyn writer who escapes to a small Michigan town to finish a long-overdue book and flee a messy personal life.

headline.main: Review: In ‘The Fugitives,’ Looking for His Muse in All the Wrong Places
headline.print_headline: Stalled Novelist, Looking for His Muse in All the Wrong Places

docs.abstract: Dwight Garner reviews book The Fugitives by Christopher Sorrentino.
docs.snippet: Christopher Sorrentino’s latest novel centers on a Brooklyn writer who escapes to a small Michigan town to finish a long-overdue book and flee a messy personal life.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than 260 asylum seekers face the prospect of being deported from Australia to Nauru after Australia's highest court on Wednesday rejected a challenge to the legality of the government's refugee policy.

headline.main: Court Rules Australia Can Send Asylum Seekers to Nauru
headline.print_headline: Court Rules Australia Can Send Asylum Seekers to Nauru

docs.snippet: More than 260 asylum seekers face the prospect of being deported from Australia to Nauru after Australia's highest court on Wednesday rejected a challenge to the legality of the government's refugee policy.

docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil's president promised a wary nation on Tuesday that no resources would be spared in the fight against Zika, addressing Congress a day after the World Health Organization declared the mosquito-borne virus an international emergency.

headline.main: Brazil President Tries to Ease Wary Nation Amid Zika Spread
headline.print_headline: Brazil President Tries to Ease Wary Nation Amid Zika Spread

docs.snippet: Brazil's president promised a wary nation on Tuesday that no resources would be spared in the fight against Zika, addressing Congress a day after the World Health Organization declared the mosquito-borne virus an international emergency.

docs.lead_paragraph: Global health officials have said that the Zika virus, which has been linked to severe birth defects in thousands of babies in Brazil, is rapidly spreading in the Americas and could infect 3 million to 4 million people. The race is on to develop a Zika vaccine.

headline.main: Factbox: Why the Zika Virus Is Causing Alarm
headline.print_headline: Factbox: Why the Zika Virus Is Causing Alarm

docs.lead_paragraph: The first Irish cases of the Zika virus have been detected in two people with a history of traveling to a country affected by the mosquito-borne infection, the Health Service Executive (HSE) of Ireland said on Tuesday.

headline.main: First Irish Cases of Zika Virus Detected: Health Executive
headline.print_headline: First Irish Cases of Zika Virus Detected: Health Executive

docs.snippet: The first Irish cases of the Zika virus have been detected in two people with a history of traveling to a country affected by the mosquito-borne infection, the Health Service Executive (HSE) of Ireland said on Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: San Antonio guard Tony Parker, a four-time NBA champion with the Spurs, told a French radio station on Tuesday that he could miss the Summer Olympics because his wife is due to give birth to the couple's second son at the end of July.

headline.main: Spurs' Parker Might Miss Olympics in Rio
headline.print_headline: Spurs' Parker Might Miss Olympics in Rio
